column4: having some trouble getting a linksys wusb11 v 2.6 (amtel chipset) to work.  downloaded amtel-firmware...still nothing in network manager.  help...please!
- does it show up in dmesg?  lspci?  lsmod?
it's recognized in lsusb and dmesg,  doesn't seem to show up in lspci or lsmod
- hold... lemme see if I can find the driver it should be using
- did you follow this guide?  https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WifiDocs/Device/LinksysWUSB11
no...somehow i managed to not find that page.
- another one https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
does that second one mention the amtel chipset or wusb11 v 2.6 adapter?  it doesn't seem to
-  if you sudo modprobe -v amtel what you get?
sorry...i've been spelling it wrong.  it's atmel.  and i get the following: insmod /lib/modules/2.6.27-8-generic/kernel/drivers/net/wireless/atmel.ko
- how about when you sudo iwconfig now?
i have a wlan0 option, but still nothing in network manager
- manually configure it from the commandline....          sudo iwconfig wlan0 essid YOURSSID
- you can also              sudo iwlist wlan0 scan
- does iwlist wlan0 scan show any APs?
ok.  what's the word on it working in network manager?
- dunno... I never use the GUI tools 'cause they are liars... yes, liars!  CLI for life!!@$?#@!
- I've had issues w network manager never doing what I want so I gave up on it... :(
interface doesn't support scanning : Network is down
- sudo ifconfig wlan0 up
i've had issues with it too.
- you can manually edit it... apt-get should have run all the automatic scripts for you though.... I'd consult !grub
i knew about the maunal edit option.  i'm not sure why it stopped updating automagically...but i was hoping for a solution that would get it updating properly again.  i'll check out !grub.
thank you.
